The ISO 7243 standard incorporates environmental temperature, humidity, and solar radiation (ISO 1989). Air temperature ( T
a ), natural wet bulb temperature ( T
nw ), and globe temperature ( T
g ) were collected using the 3M™ QUESTemp°™ 32 heat stress meter (accuracy of T
a , T
nw , and T
g ; ± 0.5 °C and RH; ± 5%) during the colder (January–February) and warmer (March–July) months. The QUESTemp uses a 5-cm diameter globe for a faster response time while the WBGT index is based on the response of a 15-cm diameter globe. As a result, the instrument correlates it to match that of a 15-cm globe. Average WBGT values and minimum and maximum values (Table 1) were measured at five brick kilns: one from Salem, Trichy, Chengalpattu, and two from Thiruvallur district. Due to access constraints from employers and other practical issues, measurements were not possible throughout the day or for a number of days. Therefore, the measurements are averages from different work sections in each workplace for between 3 and 6 h.
